bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 176 (Tuesday, October 13, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. BUCHANAN:H.R. 8580.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8[Page H5682]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

item.name: Wilderness and natural areas, wildlife refuges, wild rivers, habitats

item.text:
Little Manatee Wild and Scenic River Act

This bill designates a specified segment of the Little Manatee River in Florida as a component of the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System.

The bill withdraws the federal land within the boundaries of the designated river segment from (1) entry, appropriation, or disposal under the public land laws; (2) location, entry, and patent under the mining laws; and (3) disposition under all laws relating to mineral and geothermal leasing or mineral materials.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: Little Manatee Wild and Scenic River Act

item.title: Little Manatee Wild and Scenic River Act
Little Manatee Wild and Scenic River Act

item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced
item.title: Little Manatee Wild and Scenic River Act
To amend the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act to designate segments of the Little Manatee River as a component of the Wild and Scenic Rivers System, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
